intro: Peristrophe lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved peristrophe, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
